utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Hi, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Judge Jeanine Pirro, Geraldo Rivera, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's five o'clock in New York City, and this is THE FIVE. Get ready for another heated Supreme Court battle. Liberal Justice Stephen Breyer will be retiring this summer at the end of the high court's current term. The huge news leaking out before Breyer could officially announce it himself. Multiple sources tell Shannon Bream that the justice was surprised with how this played out. But President Biden and his White House claim, they don't know anything about it.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: There has been no announcement from Justice Breyer. Let him make whatever statement he is going to make and I'll be happy to talk about it later.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: The president has stated and reiterated his commitment to nominating a black woman to the Supreme Court and certainly stands by that. For today, again, I'm just not going to able to say anything about any specifics until of course Justice Breyer makes any announcement should he decide to make an announcement.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS (on camera)
utterances.utterance: Democrats are looking to ramming through Joe Biden's eventual nominee and follow a similar timeline that Republicans used for Amy Coney Barrett. The White House confirming that Biden is looking at a woman of color to fill the role, while getting press on who he may pick.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Is there any scenario in which the president would select his Vice President Kamala Harris for the Supreme Court?

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.utterance: Again, I'm not going to speak to any considerations, preparations, list.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: We're just wondering hypothetically and theoretically, would someone who was an attorney general of the large state and who served with many key Senate votes be an attractive candidate to the president for an open Supreme Court seat?

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.utterance: I see what you did there, Peter, but the president has every intention as he said before of running for reelection, and for running for reelection with Vice President Harris on the ticket as his partner.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS (on camera)
utterances.utterance: So, what would motivate a leak right before Breyer announces possibly from the White House?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, this is super high stakes and one of my favorite things to do is cover a Supreme Court nomination so I was quite excited today when I heard about this. Obviously, Breyer has had a very long career in the judiciary, not only in the Supreme Court but before. And so, this decision is such high stakes for any sort of president. I think, you know, now there is reporting that says his decision to announce was imminent and that the White House may be jumped the gun by a hair or somebody at the White House did or maybe not the White House. I understand why, because they have a lot of work to do. You got to get everybody in line. Now what do we report this morning on America's Newsroom? That Biden is losing in the polls, even with Democrats. So, what is one thing that they can focus the mind --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and that is a Supreme Court nomination. Now, because the filibuster rules change and you can get to a Supreme Court vote with 51 votes now. It's not as big a deal, but they only have 51 votes. Right? Fifty plus Kamala Harris.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The White House has also said it's going to be a judge, the president had said on the campaign trail it's going to be a black woman. So, you can look at how many judges there are, and I would imagine probably you could figure out their names pretty quickly. That list will come and will narrow down. Senator Schumer might not be the majority leader after the November midterms, so they had to do this right away. If they waited until the end of the term which was the end of June, that would've only given them four months and I think a lot of people including somebody like, even like Kyrsten Sinema or Joe Manchin could've said, you know what, we ought to wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We ought to wait and see. This way they can try to get it done right away.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And now I guess the nominee has to go through Manchin and Sinema a little bit. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, they hold a lot of cards.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm with Dana. This is fantastic. I, you know, immediately you think, this is the best news Joe has ever heard because he needs a historical POC, right? Who is just hanging around driving him nuts right now? It's like he could unload the Lemon and the Lemon gets a promotion. I mean, that's amazing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Win-win.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know if he's going to do it because it's an obvious ploy. I think that Merrick Garland could come out and identify as --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- a nonbinary person of color and see it become a historical first. But I'll tell you this. Whoever gets nominated, I'm going to say that that person be they male or female, or nonbinary, did something really bad to me. A long time ago. I'm not going to say what it is that they did to me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can you remember what they did?

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: High school? In high school?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It might have been. You see I don't know yet. It might've been in college, it might have been like, you know, --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: High school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- it might have been in the gym. Who knows? But I'm going to tell you whatever I say it's going to be 100 percent true. It's disgusting and I would prefer if you guys just respect my privacy when this happens. But the thing is, the question is, will the Republicans be as disgusting and partisan and vindictive --

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- as the Dems were on basically every single nominee. And I don't believe two wrongs make a right, but boy, it's going to feel good. I rather have two wrongs, sometimes two wrongs are better than a right and, in this case, I think that I want an explosive hearing with corrupt lawyers, freaky shrinks, the return of Jessica or Julie Swetnick, got to get Avenatti on like a Zoom call from jail.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Great idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: With -- and I'm going to get my -- I'm going to go and get my handmaid costume out of storage and I'm going to wear it at the Supreme Court steps.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: After --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what, Greg, as much as we all want to see that I don't think that's going to happen. Geraldo, do you see this --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I do not --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- happening the way it would have been if that had happened?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I do not. And I also call on Republicans right now to be gracious to the nominee. It's going to go through no matter what you do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Gracious. Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Be gracious, don't be like the Democrats, don't torture the nominee. I thought that Kamala Harris would be a great idea, it was the first name that jumped into my mind. She could be a terrific Supreme Court justice, an appointment for life. She's only in her 50s, she'd be there for 30 years.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You think she'd be a good justice?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think she'd be a terrific.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Would you think she has the mental --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You thought she would be a good V.P.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You thought she has a mental acuity?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That was also true, but you know. But it's a role fit for her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A lifelong appointment.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, the role does not fit for her.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's not going to happen. You know, they've already put out the, you know, D.C. circuit judge, Brown Jackson, the South Carolina district judge, Michelle Childs. Leondra Kruger. All black women. It's interesting that it's definitely affirmative action, right? As they are considering the affirmative action, the seminal affirmative action case against Harvard and University of North Carolina. So, it is ironic.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It is ironic, but I'm all for targeted, you know, there is no black woman on the court, why not do it. And the Republicans behave.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What about a Puerto Rican?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They have one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He can have more. Why not more, Geraldo? All right, Judge Jeanine.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know what?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She is my favorite judge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She is?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sotomayor.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: When -- when --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Sotomayor.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Sotomayor she was the one who gave the disinformation on 100,000 (Inaudible) --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is terrible, terrible.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But she makes great rice and beans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. That's the new --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is not even true?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- that's the new standard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I made it up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You made that up.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I made that up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Man, thank God that wasn't me.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So here is the thing. There is -- this is a coming at such an opportune time for Joe Biden. The distraction is perfect for him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: His numbers are in the tank.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know, now everybody knows Supreme Court hearing, --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- nominee hearing --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- we can get crazy. We can go lunatic.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Live TV.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And you know what, this is live TV, but I have to tell you, Geraldo, I'm tired of the Republicans, you know, playing by the mark of supreme bearer rules. I'm tired of that. I'm not saying you have to be an animal about it, but darn, let's just let people know that we have to slap in there too when we can do it. And not everybody is perfectly playing. And not, and you know what --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You can get a Republican slap a black woman around? That's going to be great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Come on, you know what I'm talking about. I'm talking about figuratively. What they did to Kavanaugh and what they did to Amy Coney Barrett, it was outrageous. And in the end what Americans want is a judge who is -- justice -- who is confident, who is smart and who is nonpolitical. We don't want politics in the United States Supreme Court. And you know what, if you want to pick a woman of color that's fine. But just make sure that she is confident. And there are confident --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, these district court and circuit judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, you had your say, this is my turn.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. So right now, you've got confident judges, you've got Judge Jackson, you've got Justice Kruger, you got several of them who've already got Senate confirmation.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So, it won't be that bad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And you're right, 50 plus one, that's all they need.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin have voted for every judicial nominee that Biden has put forward already.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the judge says that the Republicans can play dirty, so there you go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I need -- they need --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There you go. You've been given permission by Judge Jeanine.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They need to play -- they need to play --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Don't do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To play dirty.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- like they have a backbone and whatever goes with that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Look who's with them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm having an article published in the New Yorker, it will be written by Ronan Farrow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Where did she touch you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can't -- I'm going to show you on the doll.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't. We're going to do that in the break. Coming up, President Biden to finally address the crime wave as people get gunned down in hospitals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD (on camera)
utterances.utterance: President Biden finally paying attention to out-of- control violence. He is coming to New York City next week to meet with Mayor Eric Adams to talk about gun crimes. It only took a surge and lawlessness and scenes like this to catch his eye. Chaotic video shows a brazen suspect opening fire in a hospital emergency room. But I guess if you're going to get shot, that's a great place to get shot. You got to admit, you're already in the hospital. The E.R. was thrown into lockdown and leaving the victim injured. Cops nabbing the shooter later on that night. Meanwhile actor Michael Rapaport, you remember him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I remember him, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- left stunned after filming a shoplifter robbing a drugstore. Stunned.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL RAPAPORT, ACTOR
utterances.utterance: You, that -- this dude, I can't believe I'm seeing (muted). This (muted) guy just filled his two bags up with everything in Rite Aid right here at 80th and First Avenue. Just walking down the street like he's (muted) Gucci.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD (on camera)
utterances.utterance: I think we found the first or the only person left in New York who didn't know about this happening. I mean, how do you not know this is happening. It's every single day. So, Judge, what drives me nuts about the stuff, it's always about combating gun crimes but never the gunman. It's like they have a biological resistance to criminalizing the criminal and instead, they put all this emphasis on this inanimate object which never solves the problem.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, that's because guns jump out on their own and decide who to shoot. They don't need a person behind them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: This is so stupid, it aggravates me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: S-t-o-o-p-i-d.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: S-t-o-o-p-i-d.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Got it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You've been listening. Good for you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Here's the bottom line. For Joe Biden to say he's going to come to New York and he is going to help us out with gun violence. This is a guy who was silent the whole year before when he was running for president, while they were burning down businesses, and everything was mass chaos, there were shootings going on. Not one word came out of his mouth. And they are saying no, he is not -- he is not in favor of defunding the police. I've never heard him say we need to fund the police. And now he's going to come in and show us how it's done. No. We know how it's done. This is a political ploy, all it is as Democrats getting together saying, we're to be tough on crime. New York State, by the way, has the gun possession is lower than in many states that have literally zero drive-by shootings. So, in -- they want to change the laws. The only laws you need to change are bail reform, giving judges the ability to have discretion to keep someone in jail, --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- and then you need to make sure that you follow through and clear these gun cases.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly, enforcement.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Enforce the rules. How does -- I'm pounding the table, Dana. Our new table by the way that we haven't even mentioned. A brand-new table.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Beautiful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And also, interesting fact, Jesse did Pilates this morning.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You did?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But let's stick --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: On this table?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's stick to the story at hand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you talking to me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How does ending gun violence, Dana, stop the smash and grab shoplifting, the subway shoving, the random stabbings? They focus on one thing because they could somehow push it on to like the NRA or something? I don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I was wondering today, so who called who? Did Eric Adams call in and say Joe Biden, would you please to New York --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and help me figure this out? Absolutely, it did not happen, right? So, what Joe Biden's team has realized is that crime is serious because they're looking at the polls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're seeing the media coverage and not just on Fox, it's everywhere. The crime is up and 81 percent of people said they were worried about crime. So, they realize we got to do something, so we've got the shining new penny up there in New York, let's go and deal with that and talk about guns. But when we ask Jen Psaki on America's Newsroom about whether the president would take on liberal prosecutors, she's like, no. Like, no, like we're going to let them do their thing, but we can give money. Money is great. Like I'm sure that the cops would love more resources, that's great. That's not the issue. One thing that would actually be helpful on the smash and grabs is to deal with the fact that all of these people can go and then resell it, resell all of those items online.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: With no penalty. So, there might be something there that the government could actually do. That would be helpful on that thing, but they have to be arrested, they can't -- they can't be misdemeanors when you're having a shop like that like this guy walking out the store.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I still can't find out where they sell them online because I've been looking. Because, you know, its blades are really expensive. You know, Jesse, he was leave -- Rapaport was drugstore that is now closing for good because they can't keep up with the robberies which hurts elderly people like Rapaport who go there for their medication.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Elderly. He's your age.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think he's in the 70s.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is he really in the 70s?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: There's no way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But this only -- so my point is, these drugstores all they are doing is just closing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why don't they -- can they do something else to stop this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, the security guy that is standing there --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- watch the guy leave with the goods.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's not allowed to touch him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So why is he standing there with the security jacket on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's incredible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is he a mannequin? Is he a model?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, he's not -- it's false advertising.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's all because of insurance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you're going to say that's security --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- if you can't do anything about it. And the hospital situation, this, you guys got to believe how bananas this is. The guy comes in to the E.R. for an asthma situation and he brings his mother.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he sees a guy across the E.R. and the guy gave him a dirty look, so he unloads like six rounds into this guy, and then runs out of the E.R. and leaves his mother there. Gets back to the apartment in the Bronx and then the sister calls 911 and says my brother is hearing voices and he's got a gun. And they catch him because he signed his name --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He signed his name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- when he went into the E.R. And it turns out that the guy has been arrested, Greg, 15 times.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesus.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: For gun possession, narcotics, burglary, assault, you name it. And the guy that was shot for giving him a dirty look, was shot last year as well for giving someone else a dirty look. I swear to God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He must have quite a look.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I swear to God he's got nasty look on his face.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Keep your (Inaudible) down.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But only -- only in New York, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Meanwhile, Geraldo, we keep being told that Mayor Adams is going to be different but his proposal still sounds a lot like De Blasio.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No, he's bringing back plain clothes. He is really, I think reenergizing and enabling cops again. I think what disturbs you so much here, and I am similarly really outraged by it. A hospital is a place of curing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And so where do you go when you're hurt? You go to the hospital. The hospital is, you know, wherever the chaos is in the world, when you go to the hospital you go in there to get better. So, to see someone bring that violence and imagine how traumatized all the other patients were there in the emergency room. So, that and the fact that the drugstore in 80th and First Avenue, which is, you know, that's not the ghetto, that's the upper east side, that's were all the flight attendants live, a lot of the teachers live there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Flight attendants? How do you know about that?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Flight -- how do you know about that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Stayed overnight for many times.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: How do you know that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's like 15 minutes from La Guardia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to call it block (Ph) home.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So, to see -- to see a security guy basically be blind to that brazenness, breaks the rule. What's the rule? The rule is that you, society, civilization has certain norms. You know, you don't steal, you don't do all the other things in the 10 Commandments. But to see that happen so brazenly --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- with so little consequence is really outrageous. I think that what you need is a whole thing -- excuse me, Judge. I just want to say this one. You need a whole system of passive-aggressive law enforcement. Surveillance cameras on every corner, you know, everyone should get freerings.com from the government. Insurance company should not be allowed to encourage security to turn their backs on perpetrators. It's what they do to lower the premiums.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You know, I just think he has (Inaudible) --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. Let me tell you what the bottom line is here.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- the rules. He's got to --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The bottom line is, that Alvin Bragg came in office and said he's not going to prosecute people who go --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- and hold up people with guns and AR-15s, and if they steal thousands of dollars of merchandise, I'm going to charge them for like stealing a DCD. That's where the problem is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I still say the real crime and all of this, Jesse doing Pilates. We'll discuss that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, we won't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- in details.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, we won't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Straight ahead, shocking new details about the COVID cover-up that led back to Dr. Fauci.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What a shot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: Some serious questions over whether Dr. Fauci and top U.S. health officials protected China at the expense of everyone else, like us in America. New documents obtained by special reports suggest Fauci and others hid key evidence from the public at the start of the pandemic. Bret Baier breaking it down here.

utterances.speaker: BRET BAIER, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: New internal communications from the National Institutes of Health obtained by Fox News show in the earliest days of the crisis, Dr. Anthony Fauci, the head of the agency's infectious diseases institute is warned that COVID may have leaked from a Chinese government run lab. The Wuhan Institute of Virology.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: The documents also show Fauci and scientists around the world worked to suppress the lab leak theory over fears that it would have set science and international harmony. That was the part that really bothered me.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like why don't just be transparent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. We covered, and this has been out there. The biggest problem here is the experts that are scolding us on masks, mandates, and risk assessment, are the ones who risked billions of lives on this questionable science that led to millions of deaths. Fauci should probably resign and get a lawyer, no wonder Fauci was quivering whenever anybody brought up China because the paper trail doesn't just involve Chinese scientists. It involves American scientists too. Think about that class action litigation when you're talking about 12 million people dead, you can bankrupt the country. That's trillions in settlements if you want to do it. So, somebody has to go to jail, if you're arresting non-vaxxed people in Applebee's, somebody should be paying the price for this. Which is now becoming a Holocaust. Right? So now we know the experts who -- well, it's over six million dead, I'm talking about numbers. We know -- we know why the experts ridiculed the other experts who are calling this out early on, it's because they didn't want to pass off China, lose funding or go to prison. And prison should be on the table for all of these people because they took a gamble on a dangerous concept. It wasn't deliberate, the leak wasn't deliberate, right? Because the semblance of an action that had this kind of risk is negligent manslaughter. They killed millions of people, and we're not even trying to investigate.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But it's like any other crime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's not the underlying crime that is so easy to identify.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It is the cover-up. And now we have the cover-up where we have all of these doctors smeared from Oxford and Harvard, and Stanford, they'll all smeared by Fauci and his gang. Fauci and his gang then end up giving up money to all of these people, $9 million worth of grants through the NIH to people that worked with them on clarifying or amending what they thought was a case. But here -- the bottom line on this thing is that science should be about debate, it should be about criticism, it should be receptive to skepticism. I mean, that's what science is all about. So, you get together with people and you test different theories. These guys are dictators, they got together and said, you know what, whether we're responsible or not, we're going to cover it up, and you know, the hell with science. And that's what they said. He should not be in that position. I'll get one better and say he should be fired.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The guy has got $10 million in drugs. He makes $450,000. He's been there 50 years. He never had us ready for the pandemic in the first place when he said in 2017, there's going to be a pandemic that will hit this country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He knew it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I always liked Fauci because he's not a politician.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He isn't?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But let me just -- let me say this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Everybody in the world knows that the -- it's called the Wuhan virus for a reason, because it was started in Wuhan. It started in a -- within a mile of the lab where they were investigating viruses. I mean, it does not take a rocket science or virology scientist to tell us that it's probably from the lab. The question is what's the relevance of the origin right now? Now, the fact that the Chinese might be culpable, we'll catch them eventually, although they scrubbed the market, they scrubbed everything, they probably killed the interns in the lab who probably walked out with this stuff on their shoe one day. You know, we're fighting the consequences of the -- of the worldwide infection. Now, I don't -- I don't believe that this is such a big, momentous revelation that they knew.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But Geraldo, we're arresting people because they're not wearing masks.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But what's the crime, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They killed millions of people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: How about jailing people for going to work?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Causation is improbable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, Fauci and his team of scientists funded gain of function research in Wuhan. The Wuhan lab was sloppy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: America funded it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, American taxpayers funded it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, through the NIH.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it was sloppy, and it leaked, and it created mass chaos, and now people are dead. All he had to say was when we all knew that it was gain of function that escaped, sorry, this is on us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But did more people die --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then you fall on your sword and you resign? No, because, you know what, Geraldo --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But did more people die as a result of it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- they're still doing gain of function research and that's the thing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I hope that's not -- I hope that's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Gain-of-function research was not something the entire scientific community thought was a good idea. It was a small cabal of people including Fauci backed by big Pharma, and they were doing it. And because big pharma likes that risky stuff because you can get ahead on vaccines and it gives you an advantage. Now, it blew up and big pharma profited, but no one else profited. Everybody else lost a lot including their life. And that's what we want, accountability, so this never happens again.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: As outrageous as that is, it doesn't point to criminal culpability.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's reckless, negligent homicide.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You can fire him, but you can't arrest him.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You can more than fire him. Because if he was aware of, and his 40 years of experience show that he is knowledgeable, he is funding gain of function, he's smart enough to know not to admit it, that his consciousness of guilt --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. And he fudged the paperwork.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So, you believe that he was manipulating virus --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, manipulating the virus --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, I spilled it. Don't tell mom.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's manipulating the virus -- he's manipulating the virus so that they can get an advance on medicine and he can make more money in addition to the $10 million he's made from the big pharma.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And in the meantime, China gets off basically scot-free and is about to host the Olympics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Up next, parents exploding on Virginia school officials trying to keep their kids masked up. We'll tell you more.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A bare-knuckle brawl breaking out in Virginia schools as districts defy Governor Glenn Youngkin's order letting parents choose whether their kids, their own kids need to wear a mask. School board members getting an earful from upset parents and students.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It is time to quit hiding behind our children and asking them to sacrifice their youth for your fear. Enough is enough.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yesterday my daughter refused her mask upon entrance into the school and she wasn't officially segregated until 1:00. You know what she said to me when I picked her up after school? I guess COVID only comes out after 1:00 p.m., mom.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We segregated from all the other students who are wearing masks. We are told to use different bathrooms and we are told when we can and cannot go to the bathroom or go get water.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: COVID has been so disruptive, Judge. I mean, is this helping -- are these parents helping?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Which parents?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The parents that are raising the issue and making it so dramatic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They should stay out of it, right, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The children who were traumatized.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They should stay out of it. It's just the kids.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. Let's make it clear.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If there's an edict that says wear a mask, wear a mask.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No. The governor was elected. He issued an executive order. You know, even Biden lost in the Supreme Court. I know it was because of OSHA and employers with more than 100 employees. I mean, a school has more than 100 kids. Where did these school boards come up with an idea that these kids need to be masked? You know what, they're losing precious years. We're traumatizing them and they're defying the governor's orders. I don't know what's going on with these school boards. I don't know why they are so dictatorial. They're totalitarian. They want to run things.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Aren't they elected by the community?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, let me tell you right now. There's three recalls in one state I think in California, three recalls right now. And now the school boards that want to sue the state of California -- State of Virginia. This is over.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: My point is that these kids have been jerked all over the place. I mean, is this helping? Are the parents, in their emotional involvement -- you know, when you have a kid in junior high, a sixth-grader, is it the kid who's making the judgment call or is that the parents influence them, are they all over them, you know, this is -- this is wrong, this is right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're acting like they're shooting bazookas at the school board, Geraldo. They just went up to the mic and said this is BS. And that's perfectly legitimate. The school board is defying the parents and the governor. That's not how the power hierarchy works in the Commonwealth, which I love, the Commonwealth. How did they get that name? So, the question is, the science says -- I know you like to follow the science --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- actually masking these kids for endless hours all day long is worse than the COVID situation, all right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It is worse.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Says Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Says science, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Says Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Says science, Geraldo. If you disagree with me, you disagree with science, all right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And so, the situation is -- how long does this have to go, until there's one case count, two case counts? They're going to keep doing this until they can --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Forever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. It's forever pandemic. And I don't -- I want to see faces - - I want to see their beautiful faces and they want to breath.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But Dana, but these kids -- these kids, Dana, are being ping-ponged and it's dreadful.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But they're -- also, for what? They're not -- they're not following the science, meaning the people who want to keep them masked. Just for a prop? You like the Atlantic? Here's the --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- case against masks at school. I'll pass that on for reading for later. Here's the other thing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I accept service.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know how Liberals love Northern European countries?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did you know that the Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, and Sweden do not recommend elementary-aged children mask anywhere in society, including shops and transit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Those reckless socialists.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. Can you believe that? Who's actually following the science here? Let's just follow the science. The masks aren't working. There's kids that haven't ever seen their teachers' face for two years.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But the science, with due respect to both of you, isn't really the issue. The issue is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What is the issue?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The issue is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How you feel about it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- parents' militancy involvement on both sides.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, teachers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, there was no militancy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: On both sides.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There was none.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Greg, and I submit that the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You do?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- school boards are creating a situation of conflict and turmoil that is exacerbating the self-destructive, you know, phenomenon from COVID, the kids being locked up and all the rest of it. And now they want to go to school, and the parents are on one side or the other side. It's like the civil war all over.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Civil war.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I actually -- I actually think this --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: All right, a civil war, not the civil war.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but I do -- I think that there's a point there that Geraldo just made. It is kind of like a civil war. Like, people don't really know what sparks certain kinds of things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, there were -- there were things that have started wars before. This is an interesting part, because it's a very intimate issue. You can't tell me what I'm going to put on my kid's face. You are not his parents. You're just some a-hole mask fascist who loves that dopamine rush when you get to yell at somebody and you can't relinquish your control. We're in a different phase now. We can't be using the old science. We got the new science. There's research out there. This is hurting kids. The solution is obvious. Make it optional. That's the simplest thing they can do. And if they want to separate the kids, fine. But I'll tell you one thing. The kids without masks will be seen as ultimately cooler than the kids that have to walk around scared all the time because their parents are nuts. It's time for you to regain that steering wheel, America. Life has changed but we still live life. We have to embrace risk assessment and get this -- get this out of the -- out of people like Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I just had this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't want Geraldo run your life.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I just had this visual of Greg on an airplane making the same rant he just did, and being arrested, led off with his hands gaffer taped. Ahead, good for the goose, good for the gander. After claiming they're all over President Trump, some of the media now claiming the press is being too tough on President Biden. Go figure.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Some in the liberal media now making excuses for the President's tanking poll numbers.

utterances.speaker: STEPHEN COLBERT, HOST, THE LATE SHOW
utterances.utterance: Because there is a whole lot of talk in the media, no offense, also MSNBC, about the agenda stalling. What do you make of his first year? And is he right to complain about the description?

utterances.speaker: JOY REID, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.utterance: I think in one sense Biden has a point. I think that the media -- you know, I like to say that, you know, the media does have two biases, right, change and conflict, right? So if we see change, we run toward that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And the Washington Post columnist complaining the media is stuck in Biden is a failure mode. OK, Let's talk about your favorite person, Greg, Joy Reid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who's that?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: She says --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Is it Jesse?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's my favorite person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No. You know what, I'm going to ask him this, Greg, OK. She says that media, Republicans and Democrats, lay things at the feet of the President when they can't do anything about it. I doubt any president can reverse inflation. It's just not something they do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I've said this like 19 times. If Joe had Trump's press, he'd already be gone, Hunter would be in jail. That's it. And if Trump had Joe's press, he'd already be on Mount Rushmore. He'd actually be four Trumps. They would get rid of every -- there would be four busts of Trump. If he had -- they are so soft on Joe because they realize he's incompetent. But it is funny to watch liberal media interview the hard left media about how biased the media is. And they actually are in such a bubble. They can't see that they're soaking in it. They're like Madge, it's soaking in it. Remember that commercial?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, so -- but Dna, you know, this person from the Washington Post said that, you know, Biden has the opportunity to change the conversation. Vote -- they lost voting rights bill, they lost Build Back Better. It when caput. And you could hear the tectonic plates creak. The ground was shifting. Biden was moving on. As if that was a tough thing for him to do. Why doesn't -- why doesn't the press --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, and then they shoved Breyer out the door. And now they have a Supreme Court nomination that they can focus on. I'm just kidding. I'm sure Breyer made his own decision in his place.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: For somebody who works in Republican communications, it is funny to me every time that this happened with the Obama team and happen with the Hillary team. As soon as they get a little taste of what is reality, this is what conservative Republicans go through all the time with the media, and that's why Republican communicators are better because they have to try harder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. And you know, one of the -- they had a truck going around Washington that said retire Breyer. We need an African American jurist, a female African-American jurist.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's right. The left push him out.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So -- yes, so, I think he was pushed out. What say you, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think they pushed him out. And --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Breyer?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think they pushed Breyer out.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, after what happened with Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, they pushed him out early. But about this. I've never seen in my long, illustrious career in the media. I have never seen the media, not in total lockstep. They're always on the same page. They use the same phrases. They're our mob. And so, to see them disjointed, and not really knowing how to cover the president and complaining about how their colleagues are covering the president, shows me that they don't want the truth to be told because they understand how influential mainstream media coverage is to the Democratic voter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, Geraldo, just a couple of segments ago said, oh, really? It was a conspiracy theory, Geraldo, and you and many other people don't really watch any other stations besides a CNN. They read the New York Times. And if the New York Times and if CNN is saying Biden's losses are piling up, Democrats are going to be pumped up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, he's stereotyping me so I'll ignore everything he just said.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You never do that to anybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You haven't done that in this show.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: In my experience, the media, when they're talking about liberals, are like house pets. They're like dogs, but good dogs, nice dogs. Until they sense weakness, then they turn into wolves. If they sense that the audiences lost -- that Biden has lost their crowd, then they -- he falls down, they're going to eat them.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think he did fall down. "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Three times.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tonight's show is great. I got Emily Compagno, I got Joe DeVito, Kat, Tyrus. It's going to be great. We're going to talk about everything. Let's do this thing instead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Animals are great. Animals are great. Animals are great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boom. If you got to go to the bank, remember to have all your paperwork ready, your bank card, because I hate standing behind people that just don't know that there's a line behind them. But this fella came prepared. He waited patiently. He was -- I think he was depositing a few bones. No, that's what they call money, bones. Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They always have treats at the bank.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, they do. Like, sucks, lollipops. But you don't want to eat the lollipops, you know, anymore because you never know what's in them, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that was in St. Louis, Missouri, Missouri. Do you know the abbreviation for Missouri?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: MO?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What is the relevance of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No relevance, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, but that's the point. Animals are great.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I thought I might have missed them. Because I've lost this step.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, let's talk about another puppy. That is Percy the Vizsla. So, last week, he had a situation. We got a call saying, have you ever noticed he wobbles when he's resting? I'm like, what are you talking about? No. Guess what? He got accidentally -- he ingested accidentally some sort of marijuana edible. He was very poisoned.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I thought I recognized that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, he's very sick. He spent the night in the hospital, Jesse. Look at -- look at that poor little thing. It's very dangerous. It's happening all over. So, we talked to a veterinarian today. We're not going to play the sound bite. He basically said this is becoming very common. There are things you can do. You can check out my Twitter feed to find out like exactly what you need to do if this happens to your dog. 765 percent increase in calls about this happening to dogs this year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The first thing you do is you play side one of Dark Side of the Moon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Does that make them makes him howl?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That makes them happy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, got it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Jesse. That's me. National Spouses Day is today. So, we're going to celebrate Emma Watters. Here we are at Naples celebrating our anniversary there. That's Jesse Jr.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Look at that, Junior.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Beautiful wife --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are those professional photographs?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Indeed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Those were our photographers for a wedding and we booked them again for our anniversary. So, Happy National Spouses Day. And I'm going to be doing the in between show-show right after THE FIVE. It's a Fox Facebook situation. And I'm going to be promoting "JESSE WATTERS PRIMETIME." And we got again another hot show. So, make sure to watch that tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: On Facebook.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And who's on?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo. And Judge is on.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's great. Oh, congratulations to both of you. Now, this edition of Geraldo news --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: About Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --with Geraldo. So, we'll start on a woman who's not me. Watch as this free diver comes close to colliding with a curious baby whale.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my word. Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a baby?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Which reminded me of 25 years ago where I actually went with the mother.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He touched it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, I've rode the back of the whale. See?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What? Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow, look at those legs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Geraldo. Is that allowed?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, it was legal then. It's not legal now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, that is not allowed.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to be --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Swimming with the whales.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to have a career as long as you so I can show things like that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, isn't that cool.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, all right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So, we got 30 seconds. A woman creates an in-case-I-go-missing folder. And in that folder, she puts in her social media, dating site passwords, fingerprints, handwriting samples, her passport, dental medical records, tattoos, scars. She's so afraid that one day she's going to go missing, but she wants everyone to be prepared.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What a depressing person.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: She's cool crime fan for years and the folder gives her peace of mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. I know what I'm going to make Johnny do later.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Make me a folder, Johnny.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
